Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, a couple of shortcomings
Item.Review: This is my go to pocket camera for 4 season adventure with my dog. My last Olympus tough camera recently became a point & blindly shoot when the display went out in (actually in the water) the gulf. 4 things older versions did better: 1) lens cover. It's really annoying to have to clean the lens everytime I pull it out of my sandy pocket to take a picture. The older versions had automatic sliding covers. 2) Working through the menu takes longer. In simply doesn't doesn't scroll through menu options as quickly, so switching from sunset to landscape takes longer. 3) While I like a centered lens, I'm getting color diffraction when shooting sunsets that I haven't previously had problems with. Without manual settings, I can't seem to get around this. Last trip to the Oregon coast, I ... was fortunate in having my big Canon with me, but that won't always be the case. I'm still hoping to find a way around this. Changing the settings hasn't helped so far. 4) It's a little chunky for a pocket camera. Usually things get smaller instead of bigger. Okay, good things: It's starts up fast and has some nice features such as: -multiple shot series -beautiful display -fun preset modes/options -great color, clarity, & very little noise in photos -extra door locks to snug them down for underwater use -Quick options in several settings for flash, macro, and frames (single vs multi) - All the bells and whistles they advertise. I plan on using this in much the same way as the last: in freezing conditions, under water both salt and fresh, in the sand, and everywhere a person would adventure in the northwest with an active dog :) expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes usable shots in poor lighting. Fast deployment.
Cons: Optional lens thread protector comes off too easily.
I've used it for a month and I'm still getting used to it. I use it for a lot of macro shots (close-ups) of electrical equipment and machinery. Often the shots are in poorly lit environments and it delivers nice pictures without a flash. When I use the flash the colors are all true instead of being radically different, like my previous 15 year old Olympus 3040z.
As advertised it does very well in low light situations. Often I get no flash because I forced a shot before the strobe was charged and the resulting picture is fine without it.
I do wish it had about 50% more zoom. I often want just a little more than I can have.
The screen is pl ... enty bright and I've never noticed a.problem using it in sunlight.
The controls have proven fast and pretty clear. I need more time to feel truly comfortable with them.
I have not used any of the "tough" features yet but no doubt will in the future - water - drops - etc.
This camera is not a dud and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a tough camera companion. Also a shout-out to Best Buy for being the only place I could find in the USA that carried it. And, they even had it in stock! Everyone else was saying it's not yet released. I found exactly one user review of it in a day web searching. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: it's a toy and fun to play with
Item.Review: I used the camera several times in the Pacific Ocean swimming and snorkling as well at home in the pool without any problem so far. It is watertight even when I was diving through the breakuing surf. The camera is easy to use. The underwater settings are useful and make sense for common use. Don't put your finger on the microphon when holding the camera with both hands it will not improve the sound quality. The camera has the size of the panasonic LX3 and fits easy in most pockets. The limited size of the sensor is what you get for that amount of money but the color rendering is overall pleasent. So far no complaints but plenty of fun.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for a specific purpose
Item.Review: I wanted to upgrade my current underwater camera and this unit had enough advances to make it worth while. I like this camera becasue it had 1080 video, F2.0 lens, improved display, fast start up, and the ability to attach lenses. I returned a couple of other cameras because of their focusing system. This camera has a great auto focus system for photos and video. I've used it in my pool and I took a few test shots of photos and video......I've used my old Olympus 8010 for a lot of beach, activity, scuba diving, and snorkeling. After I have used this camera for a little while now I know it will be a great addition to my camera collection.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Tough Features
Cons: Image quality, lack of lens cover, can't force flash on in some modes
I was really excited for this camera. Years ago I bought the Tough 770SW and used it on long canoe and hiking trips. The tough features made it great for this because I could stick it in my life jacket or the side pocket of my backpack and not worry about it The image quality was always pretty good too. So when it was time for a new camera I upgraded to the TG-1.
Boy, did I regret that decision. Shortly after getting it I took it on a two week backpacking trip. The pictures looked pretty good on the screen, but I wasn't loving the fact that in some of the scene modes and in the auto mode you couldn't force the flash on like you could with the older model. The lack of lens c ... over had me constantly cleaning off the lens and worrying that I was going to have dirt of smudge ruining my shots. Also, the screen was scratched easily - not something you expect in a tough camera.
Then when I got home and uploaded the pictures to my camera, I cried. They didn't look good at all. The color was under-saturated and it washed out the mountains and sky. The camera also didn't handle sun reflection off of water well at all and a couple pictures had the limbs of my trip-mates glowing - an aura of light off of their arms. I was heartbroken because the great pictures I thought I had were not there at all. And all of these pictures were using the predefined scene settings or the intelligent auto setting. I wasn't monkeying around with the manual settings and having user error.
This product was returned. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, great pictures
Cons: Nothing
Bought the camera for a rocky mountain vacation. Great pictures with awesome colors. Macro produced better pictures than my Nikon. Best point and shout I have ever used. No shutter delay on any setting.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Portable but powerful. Lots of useful scene and special effect modes.
Cons: It is a bit pricey.
I bought this camera for underwater snorkeling in the Carribean but have ended up using it as my primary camera. It takes wonderful underwater shots down to 40ft using 3 underwater scene modes. Above water, we ended up leaving my girlfriends full sized Nikon setup in the room in favor of the portable and highly functional TG1; the TG1 took better shots and had the functionality of a large bag load of special lenses all in a pocket camera. We seldom took a bad shot. We especially liked the panaramic, self portait, and low light scene settings. Yesterday I took great still shots using the firework scene mode and very nice movies. This camera is very powerful, easy to use, pocke ... table, durable, and nearly mistake proof. It is very tough, but I still think I want to find a cloth pouch to put it in to protect it from scratches in my pocket. A case would be too bulky. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Pro features in an all-around point and shoot
Item.Review:
Pros: all the features you'd expect in a professional camera, neatly packaged in a life-proof shell
Cons: Settings dial is too small, hard to change without some fuss.
Does everything that olympus claims. Great photo's, scene selection is awesome. HD quality video is better than any video camera I have. Burst photo is a great feature. And zoom does just what it's supposed to. All of underwater features work equally well. It's amazing to get an underwater, HD video camera, with real zoom all in a point shoot package. A nice bonus to get incredible up close tools to get incredible details on tiny objects.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice to have a camera that isn't fragile
Item.Review:
Pros: Works well enough that it can be your main camera as long as you don't have a DSLR
Cons: Auto-focus is hard to control, Lens glass gets dirty and doesn't have a cover, a little large for a po
I've had this a few weeks now and I've put it through its paces. So far I'm happy with the quality of the images, but the video suffers from an "uncontrollable auto-focus". There's no rhyme or reason to it. Camera just is constantly pulling focus when there's a stable scene. I may need to practice a bit more, or investigate a manual option.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: great pictures and very fast
Cons: The 4x optical zoom but you can buy upgraded lenses if you can find them
My wife and I bought this camera for our up comming trip. we tried it out in the pool with no so great lighting conditions. The camera takes great pictures and is very fast. The sports mode is great. You just hold the button and it takes rapid fire pictures. With it being a water camera I wasn't expecting this to be the best camera I have owned to date but it's worth the price tag

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: If the light's right, takes a good pic
Item.Review: I wanted to fall in love with this camera. it's got some amazing specs to it... but after a full weekend of testing this out, i was incredibly let down by the low light pictures. I'm not talking low light like i was camping and there wasn't any available light - but i'm talking about pictures under a patio roof. under an umbrella. in the well lit living room. In any case where the light wasn't perfect, i had to either 1.) accept the fact that i had to use the flash (in which case, the picture looked good), 2.) muck with the settings and miss the moment to get a good no flash picture, or 3.) use no flash, and accept the fact that the lighting looks miserable. Things i love: the action shot mode is amazing. i will miss it when i return this camera. the build quality is amazing. the pictu ... re quality when in the sun is perfect. Things i can't accept and will make me return the camera: Camera has a horrible time stopping action. Shutter lag with the flash isn't always spot on and creates some poor ghosting. UNFORGIVABLE magenta hue to skin tones when the light isn't right. The menu system is nice and all, but at times its just a little bit much. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I love this camera! Very easy to use, very good image quality and has a lot of creative features. I loved the Macro option, it produce sharp and clear photos. Very good HD video quality, not to forget the Panorama and GPS options. I found one missing feature, which if it was there, it would make it a perfect camera, The lack of controlling the aperture and shutter manually.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Great new design for Olympus in their TUFF series! I really like the larger LCD display. New larger and improved lens is awesome, however I wish it had a protective lens cover like the other tuff series cameras. Ps, camera does NOT come with any memory card, so make sure you purchase one when you buy the camera.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I gotta say I heard about this camera on the TWIP podcast. I'm a professional and shoot only Canon (5D's 7D's and L series lenses). I think every pro wants a camera that is not a DSLR with all of the lenses, batteries,CF cards, Lens hoods, big bags???.etc etc. This little camera set up comes with some great options. Love the fish eye, ordering the telephoto when it's available and the camera has some killer features. I want a camera that can take a good image and a good beating. I'm going to Maui next month and thought, This camera release is perfect timing!! Can't wait to see how it performs underwater! It's going to be a big struggle leaving the DSLR's at home. But!!!....Also less baggage and worry! I'm confident I and the Olympus tg-1 tough will get the shot! I do agree with the previou ... s review. The only thing I could really want is more manual control over shutter and aperture. I'll try and add an update after the vacation for anyone who wants to see the outcome from a professional photographer. Jeffery Warren expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, and Low Light setup
Cons: some features
I really got the camera to replace an underwater camers the was lost. It is easy to use and it takes underwater pictures very well. Im trying to t=get the telephoto lenz for this model but they are out of sock with Olympus.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Waterproof, Great Picture Quality, Optional Lens Capability
Cons: A little bulkier than most digital cams but not a deal breaker.
I love love love this camera! We recently took it with us on vacation to Cancun and it took beautiful photos of the Caribbean Sea! Not to mention we were able to take it with us anywhere for that fact! We took it on underground rivers swims, into the ocean, into the pools! I cannot emphasis on all the pros this camera has! Looking forward to purchasing the 2 optional lens that are sold separately. Having the inclusive lens right in the middle of the cam versus other cams who have it on a top corner, allows alot more light to come in for the pictures! Only downside might be having to download pictures to the specific software program, but I ha ... ven't figured out how to do so otherwise. Like mentioned above, wish camera was a tad bit thinner but since it has so much protection, I cannot complain. We have dropped it once on accident! :/ and not a scratch or glitch! :) I hardly write reviews, however this camera deserved some positive feedback for those looking to purchase one! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for active outdoor adventure person
Item.Review:
Pros: what is not to like!!!!
Cons: Have not found a problem as of yet.
I had a Canon PowerShot SX 10, great all around camera. I used it on the water with a water proof carry case. It was a great system until I used it in my whitewater kayak. I needed a camera to go where I was going and it needed to be waterproof. Much research and web surfing for info on pocket cameras. There are a lot of great cameras with a lot of features, whistles & bells. Best Buy carries a lot of this type. I went over to my store and did a hands on. A wonderful staff person worked with me and answered all my questions. The Olympus Tough TG-1 is the newest from Olympus and it meat all my Needs and all my "Wants" . mounted on Kayak and all I can say is WOW. the photos and videos are unbelievable. ... This is a high tech, easy use camera. From a Point & Shoot to most of the features on a semi-pro camera. I have had this camera in places you could not take a SLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Pictures
Cons: Need time to fully learn features
Great camera, in iAuto it is a breeze to use. The camera turns on extremely fast and the focus-shoot time is excellent. Waterproof, sand proof, and rinseable without any question.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Tough right out of the box.
Item.Review: Used it out of the box for white water rafting. Lot of pics and movies turned out great and survived us getting dumped and going over the rapids without the raft. A little slow focusing on telephoto.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent image quality
Cons: Sometimes video goes out of focus and noisy video underwater in the pool
Tough cameras are known for not having the best image quality. I was pleasantly surprised with the TG1. I also own the high end Olympus XZ-1, and the TG1, although with a smaller sensor, seems to have very similar image quality. The color and clarity is beautiful. I am especially impressed with the macro and super macro photos. They seem to have more detail than some of my higher end cameras. My only concern is when I tried the camera underwater in my pool, the video had a sound ( not sure if it was the autofocus continually focusing); however, the underwater images were so clear, it looked as if I took the photos on land and not underwater. All in all, I love the TG1.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: It is what you pay for, amazing!
Cons: The strap could be better.
Took this camera rafting. Was thrown around, dropped in the water, used to take underwater photos (which turned out clear despite the murky water), passed around, dropped on the ground, carried through 100 degree heat, and still works flawlessly! The picture quality was also to awesome, even when water droplets got on the lens. Though the camera may be a little pricey I dont think I will need to buy another camera till this one croaks of old age. The features are amazing and numerous and the filters are fun! So glad I bought this camera! I had previously owned a Cannon which was great too but this camera I dont have to worry about EVER. Taking photos with it dunked in water or watching people faces when y ... ou dunk it in your water glass during dinner are priceless. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I originally purchased an Olympus xz-1. I returned it and traded in my tough 8010 for this camera and won't look back. This is an awesome camera. Slightly bigger that my canon s100, but still fits in your front pocket rather easily. As hefty as it seems, it is lighter than what you think. Fast menu system and excellent magic scenes. Wow what else can I say...gps, panorama. If the camera had a little more control over shutter and aperture, it wld be my all time top go to camera. Great lens as well. This and my new canon 5d mkIiI make the perfect pair. Also, can't Wait for the fisheye and tell lenses to ship...

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for anyone active and not
Item.Review:
Pros: just about everything
Cons: no external battery charging
Awesome camera. Love it. Durable and very easy to use. Great picture quality. Got the TG-810 last year and actually was going to get another one but no longer available. Tried the TG-1 and glad I did, AWESOME camera!!!!! Very fast picture to picture and lots of setting to tweak if i want to. This is a tough camera?!?!?! NICE!!!!!!! The battery is also a big improvement with the li-90b just need an external charger. All in all, I LOVE this camera

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I am a home inspector and I have used this camera for a while now. I really like it. It is compact, doesn't have a movable lens and drags through the attics and crawlspaces without a hitch. Takes excellent pictures. I have not been able to use all the features yet, but the ones I have used I am impressed with.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use and truly waterproof
Cons: Zoom
This camera is awesome. Took it on a trip to puerto Rico, it held up beautifully in the rain forest including the waterfalls, ocean pictures came out spectacular. We took several "photo shoots". The camera is fast in certain settings and the beauty setting is strangly great really does correct blemishes the other pic settings were unique like the fish eye effect and what not. Zoom isn't great but we bought it for the underwater feature. Looking forward to using it on our Disney cruise in two weeks.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: This camera exceeded our expectations. Very easy to use for my wife and I both. There are some cool features for filtering which work pretty good. The panoramic is best done with a tripod but it took some very nice images with that option. Overall, we are very happy with camera and performance. The fast shoot mode works amazing.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great pictures from a point and shoot tough camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Lots a features
Cons: It is what is is
Bought this for a whitewater rafting trip up to Maine. Couldn't be happier with the pictures I took both underwater and above. If you want a tough camera that takes good pictures this is the best one out there.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: feature packed go anywhere memory maker
Item.Review: Recently purchased the TG-1 for my vacation to St John USVI and so far very pleased with the quality of this camera. The photos turned out great, spent most of my time in the water with the TG-1 and captured some great shots with it. I previously owned an olympus 810 which didn't last very long at all, and was somewhat camera shy when it came to making a repeat purchase of an Olympus product, but decided to give them one more try. Even though I have only owned the TG-1 for a few weeks now I have no complaints to date. The GPS feature, along with the various settings available on the camera are really cool! You can't go wrong with the TG-1 if your looking for a go anywhere do anything camera.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: All it's cracked up to be
Item.Review: Purchased this camera for a trip to the Quetico/BWCA and wasn't disappointed! Upon first reviewing the users manual, I was worried that it would be too complicated for a quick point and shoot, but it is very intuitive and user friendly. Had a lot of fun playing with it in and out of the water, and it was great not having to worry about keeping it out of the elements! I could put it in my shorts, jump in and out of the water/canoe...no camera case required! It takes great pics too!

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Great all-terrain camera. IMO IQ is the best when compared to the current UW offerings in the marketplace. ISO up to 1600 definately usuable. For those who want lens protection, add the CLA-T01 adapter for $ and a Tiffin skylight or UV filter. Not much extra investment for a $ camera.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: great for water and moving photos
Item.Review: The camera has nice attachments that you have to buy separate. I own the wide lens and it is awesome. This is not a camera for beginners in my opinion but you don't have to go to college for photography either to be able to use it. I would read about it on olympus and see if it is right for you. I love mine.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I just bought this camera to bring on holiday as a replacement for my 810. The TG-1 is far quicker and so far about 4 days in, the picture quality seems to be far superior. Also I have to say B&H Photo, your customer service is the best - far exceeding any of your competitors...!

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: This little guy packs a punch
Item.Review: This product is very user friendly. I am not too familiar with fancy camera operations but this guy has so many options for shooting! The design is nice and tough as well.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture Quality, Features, Rugged, Waterproof, Dust proof, Lens features,
Cons: Price, power cord, has to charge with camera plugged into the wall, no separate charger for battery,
Just picked this bad boy up, read a lot of good reviews for being such a new player to the market. I've tried most rugged cameras, and each having there own bad points, good points, but I want something worth my $ and I can take on a trip and be satisfied with the results. This camera has a lot of play features I like to call them, just take a picture in different modes, and be creative. So if that is your thing,? this is your camera. As for picture quality, so far what Ive seen great, haven't had the chance for underwater yet, but I say better then the Canon d-20, Panasonic TS-3, and the ... Nikon AW100, I did however like a few things about the Canon d20, but thats another topic. havent tried every bell and whistle just yet... but a good idea what this little guy is all about.
Huge things I saw in this camera -40 foot depth water proof -rugged, dust proof, crush proof, freeze proof, -You can add lenses telephoto or fish eye Wide angle -Dual locks for doors -good in lower light -fast sport shooting of that great almost missed moment -long battery life (havent tested it but so they say) -picture quality so far of my flowers in my garden are amazing
Bad things so far -battery has no external charger, has to be plugged into camera to charge. -USB cord/charge cable is short -not a fan of Olympus buttons and rotating switch -Slow zoom in and out -Olympus in releasing a camera, and all the accessories are not available, cant even get a spare battery at this time expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: I love it. Takes great pics
Item.Review: Received this last week. Played with the camera over the weekend and it takes great pics. I have the Panasonic DMC-TS2, the Olympus takes much better pics and seems to be better built. The Panasonic started fogging the lens after few months when I take it in the pool or sea. This seems to be better sealed.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: This is TOUGH....and very easy to use
Item.Review: This brand bew Stylus Tough is very versatile, give you the best picture for a compact camera. You can take a picture of a night sky with stars and it works great. I recommend this camera.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: great features and excellent picture quality
My husband and I bought the camera for our trip to St. Lucia, so many people at the resort kept asking about my camera and was surprised that it could go under water. When I returned to the states, my coworkers were so impressed on the picture quality.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: pics are clear under the water and easy to see
Cons: zoom is sooooo slow :(
I love this camera and it is perfect to tke pictures under the water. Effects are great and easy to use. Only one thing I didn't like it is the slow zoom.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: It takes the pic when the button is pushed
Cons: Broke after one use in the water
I LOVE this camera, I take pictures of dogs so it is imperative to take them fast, no delay time.. I have tried many cameras and miss the pic because the dog moves. Not a problem with this camera. Love the picture quality. BUT took it on vacation and used it one time while snorkeling, it never worked again so I traded for another.. I am using in on dry land but scared to get it in the water again.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: it does everything well
Cons: have to buy extra battery and charger inless you want to charge batteries in the camera
bought this camera for my daughter 17th birthday she loves it takes unreal underwater pictures and AMAZING VIDEO its great out of the water also shes already had in ponds pools and the ocean many times we live on capecod .This was a great investment we cant wait for winter sking in newhampshire the camera is built like a tank but easy to use if your a teenager lol . It has so many cool features panaramic shots you stitch and many others full 1080 video is a plus

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good thing I had a 30 day trial -- I returned it!
Item.Review:
Pros: Underwater photos
Cons: Photo quality, speed
Auto feature did not function (eg no auto flash in a dark room, and no easy way to force a flash); "backlight" feature takes some 30 seconds to process once the photo is taken; long time between photos; zoom control not placed convenient. I took this camera to Alaska -- I wish I'd tested it more before the trip because almost all of my photos are very dark and terrible contrast between darker areas (eg mountains) and brighter areas (eg sky).

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Speed and picture quality
Cons: Already lost plastic piece around the lens after two weeks
This is my fourth Olympus Tough camera and they finally got it right. The others have had small issues that urged me to buy the newer version of the camera (xD cards, slow response, mediocre photos...). This one gets it all right. If it took raw images, I would leave my SLR in the closet.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Nothing
Ok, I bought this camera because when I travel I don't like to take my Olympus Pen to a beach, etc. I am a graphic designer so I am fairly picky about images. Well I am still shocked at the results from this camera. Especially if you like to take macro shots, it has a mode that utilizes the focus assist lamp to illuminate instead of a washed out flash, and I have gotten perfect exposures every time. Olympus really created a winner here. Add to that the peace of mind of knowing it can handle a bump here and there and you have what may be the only camera you will need.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I have just ran about 300 pictures through this camera. So far no problems. I haven't been able to test out some of the burst shooting features. so far so good.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Got this camera in preparation for a trip overseas. Have use it quite a bit so far and the camera is living up to the hype. The video recording took me a minute to figure out, and I havent configured the GPS yet, but I am working on it. I figure the long plane ride will also give me some time to fiddle with it. It is not a normal point and shoot camera, it does have some bells and wistles that have some getting used to if you really want to use all the options on the camera. Overall though a great buy, I still have reservations about the [$]price tag, but I guess time will tell.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Bewertung zu Olympus TG-1, 12.0 Mio. Pixel
Item.Review: The camera makes a distinct clicking noise during video recording. The microphones pick-up the clicking sound and it is recorded on the video. The noise is very loud during playback of the video. I suspect the noise is from the autofocus mechanism. The camera is totally useless for video.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: We purchased this camera for our vacation in the islands particularly for underwater photography and video. It exceeded our expectations! The pictures were very clear and so was the video (@ 1080 HD). It is also freeze-proof and shock proof (other reasons why we bought this camera.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great so far for the first week
Item.Review: I own the SW770. It is very good, but the refresh time between pictures was too long. The TG-1 has fixed that and rapid fire photography with excellent quality is now available. The bright LCD screen is the fix for the lack of a view finder.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Camera was used for snorkeling and water shots. Good color rendition and IQ. Short shuttle lag and quick startup. Very reasonable low light sensitivity. Compact and solid. Only downside is need for special cable to charge and limited zoom range (no worse than others). An ability to tighten the included strap for specific wrist sizes would have been nice - lack of solid attachment kept me from using it while jet skiing.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: We love this camera. It is small and designed nicelly. We had it only for a month but we took pictures inside, outside, in a low light places and all came out great. Sports mode really works well and pictures are sharp. We haven't tried it under water yet but planning to do so on our vacation next week. So far we are very happy with the purchase. B&H is a great store. We had the camera in 3 days after we placed the order and we chose free shipping option.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Got this for a 2-week wilderness hike in Northern NM and love it. Light, tough and takes great shots. Get extra LI-90 batteries before you take it away from civilization - 3 batteries gave me almost 1400 shots.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I took receipt of this camera the day before I left on a 7 day backpacking trip into a remote part of the Sierra Nevada. I have never had much use of my Canon SLR equipment when backpacking so point and shoots are the only way to go. Well, all I can say is this camera is AWESOME! Plenty of features and the underwater option is just incredible! Drop it, submerge it, and take tons of photos! It does it all. I like the built in affects and features. Fun camera. My only complaint is the ergonomics as the grip of the camera when manipulating the buttons doesn't feel natural. However that's a small complaint compared to what you get for the money! Oh yeah, don't worry about battery life on the go... I re-charged it with my portable battery pack that I use to charge my iPhone-it's made by Newtren ... t. Although I most likely could have gotten by on a single charge for 7 days of continuous shooting with limited flash use. The GPS is a cool feature as well. Great little camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: -this camera is mainly for my 4yr old daughter -great handling, focus and video stabilization -did a perfect job at niagara falls maid of the mist -its tough features are a main advantage where you might not use a normal camera(pro) -nice compact camera for anyone to carry along for any travel -Additional GPS feature is great taking landscape outdoors.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: This is a much improved product from the earlier generation Tough cameras. The layout is much improved, the ability to take pictures in low light is a big plus, and the overall quality of the pictures is much better. It is a great camera to have at the beach, at the pool, skiing, etc. where it is oblivious to the elements and can take decent photographs.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: For me, not worth the money
Item.Review: I previously owned a Canon D10 waterproof camera and bought this, thinking it would be an upgrade in image quality. I used it heavily for a week on vacation and did not think it surpassed the Canon D10 in image quality at all. In some cases, I think I would have gotten better shots with the Canon. A f2.0 lens is great, but at the end of the day, the small sensor still holds this camera back. Also, when wet, the mode dial is extremely hard to move and the OLED screen is hard to view in direct sunlight. These were the tipping points to make me decide to return the camera to B+H for a refund. Not worth the money in my eyes.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I have had this camera over a month. I pre-ordered and got the camera a few days ahead of the release date. Right out of the box I liked the camera but wanted to wait till after a trip to Disney to really see how it preformed. I shoot almost everything with pro-level Canon bodies and L series lenses but wanted something I could carry around on vacation without the fear of rain or bumps damaging the camera. This thing did great. The first two days we walked around in Hurricane Debbie and the rain never bothered the camera. I even got some cool shots because I did not care about the camera getting wet. On the third day my daughter was in the pool with a bunch of dance friends (They were there to dance in Dance The World for Disney). The kids had a great time taking pictures in the pool. When ... we got back to the room I dried the outside and checked under the seals and nothing. Completely dry under both doors. We put the pictures on my MacBook and the underwater pictures were great.During the main dance event I did shoot with my high end Canon DSLR. Later in the week they repeated the same number on a different stage so I decided to play with this little gem during that performance. All I can say is WOW. I put the camera in high-speed mode and it froze the dancers. The picture is a bit flat but hay it is a tough camera what do you want.Latter in the night I decided to try the fireworks setting out shooting the show over Cinderella's castle. Worked fantastic and gave some nice shots.I do have one complaint and that is I would like full control over shutter speed and aperture. In a couple of cases to get the camera to choose a higher aperture I turned the ISO up. I would like to be able to use my own experience in some situations to tell the camera what is best. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: I'm very happy with the image quality. have taken some macro shots and enlarged them. I'm impressed with the detail and depth of focus.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: This camera is awesome! Feels good in your hand, easy to operate and take fantastic photos! The toughness is an added bonus and it can get wet!

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: The reason I chose this camera over other waterproof cameras was because it took better picture in low light.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: I love this camera! Super easy
Item.Review:
Pros: Awesome picture quality
Cons: Not a thing
Great land and underwater camera. Rugged too. Pictures look great

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Works as advertised. Rugged camera with great image quality. I will have this camera with me at all times.

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again
Item.Review: Very easy to use

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Bought it to take on a recent trip to the Cayman Islands. Really glad I did, great UW shots,

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: durability

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: i use it for deep sea fishing, waterproof and is easy to use

Item.Item: Olympus Tough TG-1 iHS 12 MP Digital Camera (Dark silver)
Item.Review: Great all around point and shoot. Underwater feature works great as well.
